content.title: The Scheme Of State Award For Disabled
content.department: Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance
content.details: The 'The Scheme of State Award for Disabled' is a scheme by the Department of Social Justice & Special Assistance, Govt. of Maharashtra. In this scheme, every year, the State Government felicitates awards to the Best Disabled Employees / Employers / Placement Agencies who have done outstanding work in various fields. Only citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply for this scheme. This scheme is 100% funded by the Govt. of Maharashtra.
benefits: Best Employees (Visually Handicapped, Hearing Handicapped, Orthopedically Handicapped, Mentally Retarded): 12 awards of ₹10,000/- in Cash, a Citation, and a Certificate.
Best Employer (Govt. / Public / Private Sector): 2 awards of ₹25,000/- in Cash, a Citation, and a Certificate.
eligibility: The applicant should be an Employee or an Employer or a Placement Agency.
If the applicant is an Employee or an Employer, they should be a Person with Disability (Visually Impaired, Hearing Impaired, Orthopedically Handicapped, etc).
The percentage of disability should be 40% and above.
The applicant should be a citizen of India.
The applicant should be a permanent resident of the state of Maharashtra.
content.application_process: Offline. Step 1: Visit the District Social Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the format of the application form for the scheme from the concerned authority. Step 2: Fill in all mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across), and attach all mandatory documents. Step 3: Submit the application form to the Assistant Commissioner, District Social Welfare Office. Step 4: Acquire the receipt/acknowledgment of the successful submission.
documents_required: Proof of Outstanding Work in the respective field
Proof of Age (Birth Certificate, Marksheet of Class 10th/12th, etc)
Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra
Details of the Bank Account (Bank Name, Branch Name, Address, IFSC, etc)
Any other document required by the District Social Welfare Office

faqs.question: Are There Any Eligibility Criteria Regarding The Percentage Of Disability Of The Applicant?
faqs.answer: Yes, the percentage of disability of the applicant should be 40% and above.

faqs.question: Are Orthopedically Handicapped Persons Also Covered In This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme also covers Orthopedically Handicapped Persons.

faqs.question: Is The Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate Of The State Of Maharashtra, A Mandatory Document For This Scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Residential Certificate / Domicile Certificate of the State of Maharashtra is a mandatory document for this scheme.

faqs.question: Can I Reapply To This Scheme If I Am Already Availing The Benefits Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, you can not reapply to this scheme if you already have availed of its benefits.

faqs.question: What Is The Full Form Of SJSA?
faqs.answer: The full form of SJSA is 'Social Justice & Special Assistance'.

faqs.question: Is This A State Funded Or A Centrally Funded Scheme?
faqs.answer: This is a 100% State Funded scheme.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No, the entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: Is There Any Compensation For The Delay In The Disbursal Of The Scheme Benefits?
faqs.answer: No, there is no such mention in the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Can Applicants From The Neighboring States Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana, Etc Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the citizens who are permanent residents of the state of Maharashtra are eligible to apply.
